skill.name: theme-factory
skill.description: Toolkit for styling artifacts with a theme. These artifacts can be slides, docs, reportings, HTML landing pages, etc. There are 10 pre-set themes with colors/fonts that you can apply to any artifact that has been creating, or can generate a new theme on-the-fly.
skill.summary: Toolkit for styling artifacts with a theme. These artifacts can be slides, docs, reportings, HTML la...

security_audit.summary: OFFICIAL skill from Anthropic containing only static markdown theme definitions with color palettes and font specifications. No executable code, no external dependencies, no security concerns.

content.user_title: Theme Factory - Professional Design Themes for Artifacts
content.value_statement: Apply professionally designed color palettes and font combinations to your presentations, documents, and web pages with 10 curated themes or generate custom themes on demand.
actual_capabilities: Provides 10 pre-designed professional themes with color palettes and font pairings
Displays theme showcase PDF for visual theme selection
Applies selected themes consistently to artifacts (slides, docs, HTML pages)
Generates custom themes on-the-fly based on user requirements
Ensures proper color contrast and readability
Maintains consistent visual identity across all artifact elements
limitations: Limited to fonts available in the DejaVu and FreeSans/FreeSerif families
Requires manual application of theme specifications to artifacts
Theme showcase requires PDF viewing capability
No automatic theme recommendation based on content analysis

use_cases.title: Corporate Presentation Styling
use_cases.description: Apply the Ocean Depths or Modern Minimalist theme to a business presentation deck for a professional, trust-building appearance suitable for executive audiences.

use_cases.title: Creative Marketing Pitch

use_cases.title: Tech Product Launch
use_cases.description: Apply the Tech Innovation theme with electric blue and neon cyan to software launch presentations, showcasing cutting-edge technology with modern aesthetics.
use_cases.target_user: Tech startups, product managers, software developers

use_cases.title: Custom Branded Documents
use_cases.description: Generate a custom theme matching specific brand guidelines for consistent styling across reports, documentation, and web pages.
use_cases.target_user: Brand designers, documentation writers, web developers

best_practices: Always display the theme showcase PDF first to let users visually compare all options
Wait for explicit user confirmation before applying a theme to avoid unwanted changes
Ensure sufficient color contrast between text and backgrounds for readability
Maintain consistency by applying the theme's colors and fonts throughout all artifact elements
When creating custom themes, base color and font choices on the artifact's purpose and target audience
Test theme readability across different slide types (title slides, content slides, charts)
anti_patterns: Applying a theme without showing the showcase or getting user confirmation first
Mixing colors or fonts from different themes, breaking visual coherence
Choosing themes based solely on aesthetics without considering audience or context
Ignoring contrast requirements that could make text difficult to read
Creating overly complex custom themes with too many colors or font variations
Modifying the theme showcase PDF instead of displaying it for reference only

faq.question: Can I customize one of the existing themes instead of creating a completely new one?
faq.answer: Yes, you can use an existing theme as a base and request modifications to specific colors or fonts while keeping the overall aesthetic.

faq.question: Which theme is best for professional business presentations?
faq.answer: Ocean Depths and Modern Minimalist are ideal for corporate settings, offering professional, trust-building aesthetics. Ocean Depths provides calming maritime tones, while Modern Minimalist offers clean, contemporary grayscale.

faq.question: Can I use these themes for web pages and documents, or just presentations?
faq.answer: Themes can be applied to any artifact including slide decks, documents, reports, and HTML landing pages - any content that can use colors and fonts.

faq.question: What fonts are available for custom themes?
faq.answer: Custom themes use fonts from the DejaVu (Sans, Serif) and FreeSans/FreeSerif families, ensuring cross-platform compatibility and professional appearance.

faq.question: How do I know if a theme will work well with my content?
faq.answer: Each theme description includes 'Best Used For' guidance. Match your content type and audience to these recommendations, or review the visual showcase to see how themes look in practice.
